title: ICD-10
text: main function relating ICD-10 icd10_search() searches titles parents codes, blocks chapters. example, can search following vector obtain data.frame: want get title current code/chapter/block can use icd10_title faster requires less requests API:
code: #Search for code, specific code, chapter and block  codes <- c("D60", "IX", "I10-I15") icd10_search(token, codes) #>   searched code                                          code_title   block #> 1      D60  D60 Acquired pure red cell aplasia [erythroblastopenia] D60-D64 #> 2       IX <NA>                                                <NA>    <NA> #> 3  I10-I15 <NA>                                                <NA> I10-I15 #>                   block_title chapter #> 1 Aplastic and other anaemias     III #> 2                        <NA>      IX #> 3       Hypertensive diseases      IX #>                                                                                         chapter_title #> 1 Diseases of the blood and blood-forming organs and certain disorders involving the immune mechanism #> 2                                                                  Diseases of the circulatory system #> 3                                                                  Diseases of the circulatory system #Search for code, specific code, chapter and block  codes <- c("D60", "IX", "I10-I15") icd10_title(token, codes) #>   searched                                               title #> 1      D60 Acquired pure red cell aplasia [erythroblastopenia] #> 2       IX                  Diseases of the circulatory system #> 3  I10-I15                               Hypertensive diseases

title: ICD-10
text: Given chapter can also list blocks chapter well chapters block: command allows search inside code:
code: icd10_blocks(token, chapter = "III") #>     codes                                                          title #> 1 D50-D53                                           Nutritional anaemias #> 2 D55-D59                                            Haemolytic anaemias #> 3 D60-D64                                    Aplastic and other anaemias #> 4 D65-D69 Coagulation defects, purpura and other haemorrhagic conditions #> 5 D70-D77               Other diseases of blood and blood-forming organs #> 6 D80-D89               Certain disorders involving the immune mechanism icd10_codes(token, block = "D55-D59") #>   codes                                title #> 1   D55      Anaemia due to enzyme disorders #> 2   D56                         Thalassaemia #> 3   D57                Sickle-cell disorders #> 4   D58 Other hereditary haemolytic anaemias #> 5   D59          Acquired haemolytic anaemia icd10_codes(token, block = "D55") #>   codes                                                              title #> 1 D55.0 Anaemia due to glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase [G6PD] deficiency #> 2 D55.1           Anaemia due to other disorders of glutathione metabolism #> 3 D55.2                     Anaemia due to disorders of glycolytic enzymes #> 4 D55.3                  Anaemia due to disorders of nucleotide metabolism #> 5 D55.8                             Other anaemias due to enzyme disorders #> 6 D55.9                        Anaemia due to enzyme disorder, unspecified

title: ICD-10
text: codes available across releases. example, C80.0 code 2008 release ICD-10. Hence using release find : However can use icd10_code_search_release search release containing code: use one releases instead:
code: icd10_search(token, "C80.0", release = 2008) #> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Request not found. Possibly any of release, #> chapter/block/code or language is not available or incorrectly specified. #> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Request not found. Possibly any of release, #> chapter/block/code or language is not available or incorrectly specified. #>   searched chapter chapter_title #> 1    C80.0    <NA>          <NA> icd10_code_search_release(token, code = "C80.0") #> [1] "2019" "2016" "2010" icd10_search(token, "C80.0", release = 2016) #>   searched level_0                                             title_0 level_1 #> 1    C80.0   C80.0 Malignant neoplasm, primary site unknown, so stated     C80 #>                                             title_1 level_2 #> 1 Malignant neoplasm, without specification of site C76-C80 #>                                                               title_2 level_3 #> 1 Malignant neoplasms of ill-defined, secondary and unspecified sites C00-C97 #>               title_3 level_4   title_4 #> 1 Malignant neoplasms      II Neoplasms

title: ICD-11
text: function automatically assigning ICD-11 code diagnostic text icd11_autocode(): Code results list multiple entries. particular, theCode give ICD-11 code identified: matchScore gives number 0 1 specifying good match . perfect match 1 -match 0.
code: #Auto code a diagnostic text such as `cerebrovascular accident` code_results <- icd11_autocode(token, "Patient with cerebrovascular accident") #Recover the code that matched code_results |> retrieve("theCode") #> [1] "8B20" #Recover the code that matched code_results |> retrieve("matchScore") #> [1] 0.7573679

title: ICD-11
text: matched code 8B20 previous section can look icd11_codeinfo. lot information retrieved code: particular: * parent gives information chapter/section/block code belongs , * @id returns URI main indexing code online system, * title name code, * exclusion conditions included, * definition provides medical description means, * browseUrl link online website search * relatedEntitiesInMaternalChapter related codes chapter maternal disease can use retrieve function access elements list directly:
code: #Recover the code that matched code_info <- icd11_codeinfo(token, code = "8B20") names(code_info) #>  [1] "@context"                         "@id"                              #>  [3] "parent"                           "browserUrl"                       #>  [5] "code"                             "source"                           #>  [7] "classKind"                        "postcoordinationScale"            #>  [9] "title"                            "definition"                       #> [11] "exclusion"                        "relatedEntitiesInMaternalChapter" #> [13] "indexTerm" code_info |> retrieve("title") #> [1] "en"                                            #> [2] "Stroke not known if ischaemic or haemorrhagic"

title: ICD-11
text: icd11_search() function allows search text retrieve codes contain text. example, can search codes containing related malaria: can retrieve() codes titles :
code: abortion_codes <- icd11_search(token, text = "malaria") tibble::tibble(   code = abortion_codes |> retrieve("theCode"),   title = abortion_codes |> retrieve("title") ) #> # A tibble: 36 × 2 #>    code   title                                                                #>    <chr>  <chr>                                                                #>  1 1F45   Malaria without parasitological confirmation                         #>  2 1F4Z   Malaria, unspecified                                                 #>  3 1F42.Z Plasmodium malariae malaria without complication                     #>  4 1F44   Other parasitologically confirmed malaria                            #>  5 KA64.Y Other specified parasitic diseases in the fetus or newborn           #>  6 1F40.Z Malaria due to Plasmodium falciparum, unspecified                    #>  7 1F43   Malaria due to Plasmodium ovale                                      #>  8 1F41.Z Plasmodium vivax malaria without complication                        #>  9 QC42.Y Other specified personal history of infectious or parasitic diseases #> 10 KA64.1 Congenital falciparum malaria                                        #> # ℹ 26 more rows

text: examples ’ll assume already CLIENT_ID CLIENT_SECRET API obtained Generaring token article. interact API ’ll need continuously create token using get_token function: Note tokens last 1 hour hour passes ’ll need generate new token. package try auto-generate one . three main objectives package: Use DORIS system obtain underlying cause death. Use ICD-11 codify causes death. Use ICD-10 search causes death.
code: library(WHOicd)  #Substitute CLIENT_ID and CLIENT_SECRET by your credentials token <- get_token(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET)

what: DORIS (WHO Digital Open Rule Integrated Cause of Death Selection)
title: Retrieve data from the World Health Organization (WHO) International Classification of Diseases (ICD) API version 2
text: Digital Open Rule Integrated Cause Death Selection, DORIS, provides framework obtaining underlying cause death death certificate. DORIS functionality implemented doris function. following example considers 60 year old female whose primary cause death 2D42: Malignant neoplasms ill-defined sites due 2E03: Malignant neoplasm metastasis bone bone marrow due CB41.0Z: Acute respiratory failure, unspecified. options available function’s help page doris().
code:
doris(token, sex = "Female", age = iso_8601(years = 60), cause_of_death_code_a = "2D42",       cause_of_death_code_b = "2E03", cause_of_death_code_c = "CB41.0Z") #> $`Underlying cause of death (UCOD)` #> [1] "2D42" #>  #> $`UCOD URI` #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/2023965817" #>  #> $`UCOD with postcoordinated information (if available)` #> [1] "2D42" #>  #> $`UCOD postcoordinated URI` #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/release/11/mms/2023965817" #>  #> $`Detailed explanation (report)` #> [1] "SP4: 2E03 is the starting point of the first-mentioned sequence (2D42 due to 2E03), which is selected as the tentative starting point (TSP).
M1: There is a special instruction on 2E03 reported with mention of 2D42.
M1: 2D42 is selected as the TUC.
M3: The tentative underlying cause is not the same as the starting point selected in Steps SP1 to SP8. Repeat steps SP6, M1 and M2.


Full report:
SP1: is not applicable.
SP2: is not applicable.
SP3: is not applicable.
SP4: 2E03 is the starting point of the first-mentioned sequence (2D42 due to 2E03), which is selected as the tentative starting point (TSP).
SP6: is not applicable.
SP7: is not applicable.
SP8: is not applicable.
M1: There is a special instruction on 2E03 reported with mention of 2D42.
M1: 2D42 is selected as the TUC.
M1: There is no special instruction applicable with TUC 2D42.
M2: is not applicable.
M3: The tentative underlying cause is not the same as the starting point selected in Steps SP1 to SP8. Repeat steps SP6, M1 and M2.
SP6: is not applicable.
SP7: is not applicable.
SP8: is not applicable.
M1: There is no special instruction applicable with TUC 2D42.

" #>  #> $reject #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $error #> NULL #>  #> $warning #> NULL

title: Retrieve data from the World Health Organization (WHO) International Classification of Diseases (ICD) API version 2
text: main functions relating ICD-11 icd11_search() icd11_autocode(). first one allows search specific diagnosis using keywords inside ICD-11 either Mortality Morbidity Statistics (MMS) International Classification Functioning, Disability Health (ICF). following example searches coding related Dementia related HIV stage 4 Another function importance autocode reads plain-text diagnostic text returns best matching code either MMS ICF Additional information ICD-11 can found ICD-11 article
code: #Look for Dementia and HIV stage 4 search_results <- icd11_search(token, "Dementia HIV stage 4")  #Recover all of the titles matched search_results |> retrieve("title") #> [1] "Dementia due to human immunodeficiency virus [HIV disease clinical stage 4 associated with tuberculosis, unspecified]"                  #> [2] "Dementia due to human immunodeficiency virus [Other specified HIV disease clinical stage 4 associated with tuberculosis]"               #> [3] "Dementia due to human immunodeficiency virus [HIV disease clinical stage 4 associated with malaria, unspecified]"                       #> [4] "Dementia due to human immunodeficiency virus [Other specified HIV disease clinical stage 4 associated with malaria]"                    #> [5] "Dementia due to human immunodeficiency virus [HIV disease clinical stage 4 without mention of tuberculosis or malaria, unspecified]"    #> [6] "Dementia due to human immunodeficiency virus [Other specified HIV disease clinical stage 4 without mention of tuberculosis or malaria]" #Auto code a diagnostic text such as `cerebrovascular accident` code_results <- icd11_autocode(token, "Patient with cerebrovascular accident")  #Recover the code that matched code_results |> retrieve("theCode") #> [1] "8B20"

title: Autocode — autocode
text: token (list) Access token API obtained get_token() text (stirng) String autocode ICD-11 release Release version listed https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/SupportedClassifications/#supported-classifications--versions default 2024-01. linearization (character) ICD-11 linearization (default = "mms"). See linearizations API website https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/APIDoc-Version2/#-icd11-linearizations subtrees_filter (string) Optional parameter. Vector URIs. provided, search performed entities provided descendants match_threshold (string) Score value 0 1 indicates similarity input text matched term. match_threshold minimum score included output. use default value threshold provided language (character) Language request. Available languages listed https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/SupportedClassifications/ default English (language = "en"). auto_update Attempts update token automatically

title: Autocode — autocode
code: # Assuming that the CLIENT ID and CLIENT SECRET are set up. Substitute accordingly if (exists("CLIENT_ID") & exists("CLIENT_SECRET")) {   # Generated token   token <- get_token(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET)    # Search for ICD-10 releases   icd11_autocode(token, text = "Cerebrovascular accident") } #> $searchText #> [1] "Cerebrovascular accident" #>  #> $matchingText #> [1] "cerebrovascular accident" #>  #> $theCode #> [1] "8B20" #>  #> $foundationURI #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/1442995018" #>  #> $linearizationURI #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/release/11/2024-01/mms/1442995018" #>  #> $matchLevel #> [1] 0 #>  #> $matchScore #> [1] 1 #>  #> $matchType #> [1] 0 #>   # Assuming that the CLIENT ID and CLIENT SECRET are set up. Substitute accordingly if (exists("CLIENT_ID") & exists("CLIENT_SECRET")) {   # Generated token   token <- get_token(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET)    # Search for ICD-10 releases   icd11_autocode2(token, text = "Cerebrovascular accident") } #> $searchText #> [1] "Cerebrovascular accident" #>  #> $matchingText #> [1] "cerebrovascular accident" #>  #> $foundationURI #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/1442995018" #>  #> $matchLevel #> [1] 0 #>  #> $matchScore #> [1] 1 #>  #> $matchType #> [1] 0 #>

title: Code info — code_info
text: token (list) Access token API obtained get_token() code code code combination looked . (& / characters need URL encoded) release Release version listed https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/SupportedClassifications/#supported-classifications--versions default 2024-01. linearization (character) ICD-11 linearization (default = "mms"). See linearizations API website https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/APIDoc-Version2/#-icd11-linearizations convert_2_terminal default FALSE, set TRUE, codes changed use terminal codes (leaf nodes hierarchy). cases done changing code unspecified residual child include Either NULL provide additional information ancestor, decendant diagnosticCriteria. example, set include="ancestor" returned response include ancestor entity URIs requested entity. Use vector include multiple properties. example include = c("ancestor", "diagnosticCriteria") language (character) Language request. Available languages listed https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/SupportedClassifications/ default English (language = "en"). auto_update Attempts update token automatically flexible_mode Normally, icd11_codeinfo returns error provided code combination includes codes predefined suggested value sets entity. flexible_mode set TRUE, return result even postcoordination values defined value sets. case, codes whose postcoordination axis detected ('/' postcoordination) placed otherPostcoordination rubric.

title: Code info — code_info
text: Users prefer icd11_codeinfo() icd11_codeinfo2 developers additional applications directly result API. icd11_codeinfo() makes two requests identify code terms URI return information URI

title: Code info — code_info
code: # Assuming that the CLIENT ID and CLIENT SECRET are set up. Substitute accordingly if (exists("CLIENT_ID") & exists("CLIENT_SECRET")) {   # Generated token   token <- get_token(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET)    # Search for ICD-11 URI across multiple releases   code_info <- icd11_codeinfo(token, code = "8B20")    #Use retrieve function to obtain more information   code_info |> retrieve("title")   code_info |> retrieve("definition") } #> [1] "en"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      #> [2] "Fulfills criteria for stroke in acute symptoms of focal brain injury that have lasted 24 hours or more (or led to death before 24 hours), but subtype of stroke (ischemic or haemorrhagic) has not been determined by neuroimaging or other techniques."  # Assuming that the CLIENT ID and CLIENT SECRET are set up. Substitute accordingly if (exists("CLIENT_ID") & exists("CLIENT_SECRET")) {   # Generated token   token <- get_token(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET)    # Search for ICD-11 URI across multiple releases   icd11_codeinfo2(token, code = "8B20") } #> $`@context` #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/contexts/contextForCodeInfo.json" #>  #> $`@id` #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/release/11/2024-01/mms/codeinfo/8B20" #>  #> $code #> [1] "8B20" #>  #> $stemId #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/release/11/2024-01/mms/1442995018" #>

title: Interface for the DORIS system of WHO — doris
code:
# Assuming that the CLIENT ID and CLIENT SECRET are set up. Substitute accordingly if (exists("CLIENT_ID") & exists("CLIENT_SECRET")) {   # Get the Token   token <- get_token(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET)    # Check a 25 year old male with immediate cause 1C8Z   # due to 1C62.3Z   doris(token,     sex = "Male", age = iso_8601(years = 25), cause_of_death_code_a = "1C8Z",     cause_of_death_code_b = "1C62.3Z"   )    # Check a 52 year old with immediate cause "GB61.Z" due to GB60.Z   # due to 5A11 due to BA00.Z with other significant issues contributing to death   # being 3A9Z and BC45   doris(token,     sex = "Male", age = iso_8601(years = 25), cause_of_death_code_a = "GB61.Z",     cause_of_death_code_b = "GB60.Z", cause_of_death_code_c = "5A11",     cause_of_death_code_d = "BA00.Z", cause_of_death_code_part2 = c("3A9Z", "BC45")   ) } #> $`Underlying cause of death (UCOD)` #> [1] "5A11" #>  #> $`UCOD URI` #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/entity/119724091" #>  #> $`UCOD with postcoordinated information (if available)` #> [1] "5A11/BA00.Z" #>  #> $`UCOD postcoordinated URI` #> [1] "http://id.who.int/icd/release/11/mms/119724091 / http://id.who.int/icd/release/11/mms/761947693/unspecified" #>  #> $`Detailed explanation (report)` #> [1] "SP4: 5A11 is the starting point of the first-mentioned sequence (GB61.Z due to GB60.Z due to 5A11), which is selected as the tentative starting point (TSP).
GB61.Z, GB60.Z, BA00.Z, BC45 is a manifestation of the selected underlying cause of death 5A11/BA00.Z and it is added as a postcoordination.


Full report:
SP1: is not applicable.
SP2: is not applicable.
SP3: is not applicable.
SP4: 5A11 is the starting point of the first-mentioned sequence (GB61.Z due to GB60.Z due to 5A11), which is selected as the tentative starting point (TSP).
SP6: is not applicable.
SP7: is not applicable.
SP8: is not applicable.
M1: There is no special instruction applicable with TUC 5A11.
M2: is not applicable.
M3: The tentative underlying cause is the same as the starting point selected in Steps SP1 to SP8.
GB61.Z, GB60.Z, BA00.Z, BC45 is a manifestation of the selected underlying cause of death 5A11/BA00.Z and it is added as a postcoordination.
" #>  #> $reject #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $error #> NULL #>  #> $warning #> NULL #>

title: Search — search
text: token (list) Access token API obtained get_token() text text component search ICD-11. release Release version listed https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/SupportedClassifications/#supported-classifications--versions default 2024-01. linearization (character) ICD-11 linearization (default = "mms"). See linearizations API website https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/APIDoc-Version2/#-icd11-linearizations subtrees_filter (string) Optional parameter. Vector URIs. provided, search performed entities provided descendants subtrees_filter_foundation_descendents subtrees_filter used search looks linearization descendants entities subtrees_filter. subtrees_filter_foundation_descendents set TRUE, search looks foundation descendants entities subtrees_filter. Default value: FALSE include_keyword_result Boolean. Optional parameter. set TRUE, search result also include keyword list. Default value: FALSE chapter_filter Vector chapter codes e.g., c("01","02","21"). provided, search performed chapters. use_flexisearch Boolean. Changes search mode flexible search. Default value: FALSE flat_results Boolean. Optional parameter. set true search result entities provided nested data structure representing ICD-11 hierarchy. Default value: true. highlighting_enabled Boolean. Optional. set FALSE search result highlighting turned . Default value: FALSE. Highlighting html format. medical_coding_mode Boolean. mode default used searching classification medical coding purposes. Default value: TRUE. properties_to_be_searched String. properties included search. Used medical_coding_mode=FALSE language (character) Language request. Available languages listed https://icd..int/docs/icd-api/SupportedClassifications/ default English (language = "en"). auto_update Attempts update token automatically
